My main complaint is the battery life is nothing like the 6 months advertised. For example if my video doorbell is set to 'Balance Surveillance' the battery life is about 7 days. The video shows an example of the home owner using the doorbell and app to confront a shady person looking at their home. This could not happen if the doorbell is set to 'Optimal Battery Life'. Therefore if you need your doorbell for surveillance the only option is to hard wire the doorbell.

RING that has annual fee) . In the first year of having Eufy cameras,  came across a few incidents that we needs to see when/who. Although I cannot fault its performance and would consider it to be the best on the market, as is their support service which is first class.

Eufy weren’t helpful and offered only for us to purchase a new one which after how much we spent on the first two (not to mention family and friends we’d recommended to) wasn’t something we were prepared to do so we moved the second doorbell we were using elsewhere to the front, now this one has the same issue rendering it completely useless as we can’t hear anything people say. I tried to claim consumer law as purchased directly from them and they followed up with “If you buy the same exact camera you can have 30% off”. Why would I want the same camera that is clearly not fit for purpose. Why should I pay anything. IP67 should not fail in less than two years, especially as I’ve got a second one that’s been used for the same period of time in the same garden. This is not the first issue I’ve had with their product, they had a feature that allowed recording based on your location and it took months of emailing to no resolve, before I gave up. As soon as the few cameras I have remaining break I’ll 100% be going elsewhere and actively telling people to avoid this brand.

very bad, I am very sad and furious fir the AI answers i got to my mails. and my problem is not yet solved

Review.Titre: I bought a robot vac through their…
Review.Contenu: I bought a robot vac through their website for their Black Friday sale. I also always refund policies before I buy products because I do not want to get stuck with something that doesn’t work with what I need it for. I received the unit, charged it, and ran it. It didn’t pick up some things no matter what suction I had it on, and the brush kept popping off. I contacted Eufy for a return and they are telling me that if it’s not a defect, I have to pay to return it. I don’t remember reading that in the return policy. I also saw that robot vac that I bought was way cheaper on Amazon with prime and free returns. I went to reread their refund policy on their website in which that under “30-Day Money-Back Guarantee for Any Reason” it never mentions anything about paying for returns. Only more paragraphs down under “Warranty Claims for Quality-Related Issues” is it found. As a consumer, if I’m not looking for warranty related things, why would I read that? Why would you hide paying shipping for a refund under there?It honestly seems predatory and I’m not surprised by finding out the company is based out of china.

Review.Titre: The products do NOT work after a very…

The picture quality is shocking. Suppose to have face recognition but cant save the faces. Night vision isn't clear enough. Lense coverage isnt as wide as states. Delay on responses. Delay when speaking to people. No difference between 1080 and 2K cams. Says no monthly fees yet cloud storage chargeable feature. Local storage on 128gb don't even get a full 24hours. Doesn't record live view. Only records for 12 sec yet settings 120sec. Battery isn't removable so have to charge the whole device - either have to purchase 2 or not have security during charging.

Review.Titre: We are still  awaiting delivery as…
Review.Contenu: We are still  awaiting delivery as Evri, despite having a collection point in our village shop, a little along the road from us, could not find our address. They then said that they had after all, delivered our order, without of course having any proof of where they were claiming that it had been delivered.We are thoroughly dissatisfied, as we paid for our order nearly a month ago

Review.Titre: I wouldn’t this again if I had the chance
Review.Contenu: Purchased the light which was simple. Delivery took ages. At night I am having to switch the power supply off to the light as it’s constantly picking up people, animals and more when people walk or drive over 20 feet away from the front of my house. The light is far too bright. I have it on the lowest setting and it still illuminates the houses on the other side of the road. Customer service is atrocious to resolve the sensor issue and blaming me for not responding in a timely manner when it takes them 2 days to reply to an email. If the light worked as advertised I’d be happy with it but as it doesn’t it’s costing me a fortune in electricity and time wasting.

Unfortunately I cannot review the product as I never received it. Parcel was supposedly delivered yesterday according to Evri tracking provided. No parcel from Eufy received.Despite providing them evidence that none of the parcels in the delivery could possibly have contained the camera due to the size of the parcels, they are adamant that I am at fault and therefore will not proceed with a replacement or refund.Having to raise a chargeback claim via PayPal to attempt to recoup my lost funds.If you are going to buy a product, never buy from eufy.com directly

Customer service is absolutely shocking! To be fair I don't think there is any after care or customer service, I ordered 2 items and only received one, no update on my missing item, have tried to contact them and still waiting for response.

Review.Titre: Purchased an early bird voucher for…
Review.Contenu: Purchased an early bird voucher for Black Friday on the understanding that it assured a lower price... Paid and received an invoice.  All good so far.  But, No voucher/code arrived.Tried Eufy online help - but just got an automated response system that was useless, irrelevant, unhelpful, circular and extremely irritating.  Gave up for a while. Tried various other angles for getting through to a (dare i suggest) person. Not much use from the Eufy website.  However, Google came up with a contact number... but not before I was assailed by Eufy automated sales calls and emails.  Yuk!The person i spoke to sounded like they through i was a thief!  the underlying feeling presented was, 'we are right, you must be wrong'.    I get the feeling that this is a technology company with little or no understanding of people!After repeating the facts several times I was told 'we'll investigate,... and get back to you.  Sub text, 'we'll get back to you if we can't prove you're wrong'.  I asked and was told it would take 1 to 2 days to investigate... and and email arrived promsing, 'A specialist from our support team will contact you within 1-2 business days to help you resolve the issue.'  That was 9 days ago and .... and I'm still waiting to hear from Eufy But an email voucher has arrived with no explanation as to how it can be used.. Click the link and it takes you to a page showing the camera system I planned to buy... but now they have increased the price by £200 above than the previous price. ... And, there is no click-through to purchase the item.  HOPELESS.  Incompetent.However, this email was only sent to me after the Eufy marketing system sent an email with USD prices.. which are 40% lower than the UK Black Friday prices... and 80% lower than the price they are now showing for UK buyers.Are Eufy incompetent, confused or dishonest?
Two floodlight cameras malfunctioned. Eufy will not stand over their products. Really disappointed and really advise against purchase of their products.

Eufy did promote with an timing offer. I purchased in the night - uninformed. The next day the offer was repeated. So i declined the package.I AM STILL WAITING FOR RESPONSE AND MY MONEY. DO NIT ENGAGE FOR BUSINESS HERE!

I cannot see any way of linking my cameras at the back of my house to one router and the cameras at the front of the house to the other router.The clock on the various cameras is not in sync with the actual time- the 3 cameras which are not near the router are an hour out of sync whereas the front camera which is near the router is at the right time. I'm not that techy so we're I to remove the 1tb hard drive how would I go about viewing it?

Not thrilled with eufy and it's a shame as we have a few devices. Having inherited a security system and therefore needing the eufy app, we chose eufy products as we were already in the ecosystem. It's just all been quite disappointing. While the security system is OK, just OK (slow alerts, clunky app and regular false alarms), the robot vacuum has been a big disappointment, it simply doesn't work properly. Fine, these things happen. What's really disappointing is the support. After a ludicrous back and forth over email and a barrage of questions, it's now been a week of silence since the case was referred to the technical team. It's a surprisingly poor customer service and just an all round frustrating experience for an expensive product. Disappointing, I really wanted to like eufy.

This company discriminates against Military members serving the U.S.!I really (I mean REALLY) liked my Eufy and when I wanted to upgrade, I tried to order directly from the company (skip lining the pockets of bulk business). Come to find out, they will not ship to a US address used by military members.Please! No matter how much you might enjoy a product from a company, help support the military members and their families that sacrifice every day to protect you. Having the ability to still get the same items we would buy if we were stateside is such a huge deal, and that may not make sense if you have never lived outside the US, but it is!This is a discriminatory practice. Mailing a package to my US address costs exactly the same as mailing it to someone's street address in the US.

So I had to again call up the customer car, who confirmed that the second product was in stock and took an action to ship it to meI wouldn’t have expected to call up customer care, even once, for getting the products I ordered online. I'm going to have to get rid of it as it's not fit for purpose and makes me physically angry every day. Hate it.
no after service still waiting on a delivery to be made no email t say it is delayed still waiting on referal awards after 1 week of buying

Review.Titre: Eufy 2k doorbell - the battery works for a year
Review.Contenu: I bought a rechargeable doorbell - Video Doorbell 2K. The operation of the doorbell was ok, but I did have to recharge it many times over the year. I bought it in May 2022 and I haven't been able to recharge it in August 2023. It will not hold a charge. It has a warranty of a year and given the environmental considerations it is not possible to swap out the battery. I like that there is no contract - that us why I bought it, but if I knew it was going to have such a short life costing over £200. I don't think I would have bought it.

They have probably the worst customer service I have ever experienced. I was asking live chat a question regarding security and they kept giving me copy and paste, unhelpful responses. The Accu has been delivered promptly. Now after installing I discovered that the Rotors don't stop when Eufi is in the station. I have to switch it of manually. Therefor I'm frustrated because I choose the original space part which is more expensive.

Review.Contenu: Product was out of stock when ordered, which was fine. Product then became available to buy on Amazon a month before item was actually dispatched. I can understand running out of stock, but cannot understand how it is acceptable to prioritise new orders over existing orders that have already been delayed months.

Look to someone else

Review.Titre: Wouldn’t buy this a second time
Review.Contenu: Thought this was a really good system but a few things have changed my mind. The doorbell detects non human things quite often which is annoying, it also picks up animals so you get pointless alerts for cats, foxes etc. the firmware updates often leave the cameras with a white noise feedback which means you have to clear the system and basically reboot and re connect the cameras to the Homebase again. Perhaps one of the most annoying things is that after 2 years the glass camera lens cover on the doorbell just drops out - after googling this I found that lots of people have had the same issue generally after 2 years of ownership - for an external item which purports to be weather proof, it’s not fit for purpose. Avoid.

Review.Titre: Poor quality product with inflated marketing claims and refusal to support
Review.Contenu: We bought two Eufy IP cameras on the basis of decent video quality, motion detection and battery life - they advertised a year between charges for the last of these. Video quality is decent, and exterior build quality is good, but the rest is far below both billing and reasonable expectation:1. We're in a quiet rural area, with optimal battery life enabled. We get - at best - a month between charges on each camera2. Motion detection is arbitrary - works when it feels like it and sulks the rest of the time.3. Homekit integration is incredibly slow4. Range is shockingly poor - both of our cameras are within 7m of the base station, yet frequently drop out of coverage5. Support is poor: we raised the issue of one of the cameras not taking a charge properly when we'd had them less than two months - Eufy support did not offer a solution. It's now got to the stage where that camera is unusable, but now of course they just say that it's beyond the warranty period, shrug their shoulders and ignore the issue.On the basis of our experience, we will not be buying any more Eufy products and - even if our experience with the actual cameras was atypical, their failure to support their product is probably universal. Definitely not recommended.

Review.Titre: Suggestions were given but none worked…
Review.Contenu: Suggestions were given but none worked - I have a 2 year old product on which I have replaced the parts stated by service at cost to me and the Robovac still gets hopelessly lost. I guess this is software designed to be obsolete after warranty expires as impacted hardware is brand new.

I bought eufy cam 2C 16 April 2023, they say the battery life of the camera is 180 days but untill now i charged 3 times, I talked with costumer service for upgrade solar charger camera but they said you passed our return policy I can understand this but they told me we can give money back %70 I didint accept this offer, now I am waiting fixing my Cam Battery. I will let you know any update.

Good for the cameras, but terrible doorbell.I got a set of cameras and a homebase which worked perfectly (in spite of the battery life below advertised values), which then encouraged me to get the doorbell.The doorbell and its base never worked flawlessly for more than a week. The remote keeps disconnecting and the base keeps freezing and not responding to the app. Sometimes a reset will fix it, sometimes it won't, but it never works consistently for more than 5 days.I've been in contact with Eufy support for the last year, and got sent a broken, refurbished replacement, which is now piling up as paperweight at home. Now they keep asking for proof of the faults (and I keep sending), but no actions are taken. Almost deciding to give up and buy a different brand, and keeping Eufy as an expensive paperweight.

Review.Titre: Ordered end of November with a 5-7…
Review.Contenu: Ordered end of November with a 5-7 working day delivery.  Emailed on the 8th December (after 9 working days) as not arrived to be told it would be shipped mid December even though we weren't told this.  Emailed again on the 22nd December (19 working days) with a reply on the 23rd to be told it would ship in 3 working days which puts it a total of 23 working days without a clue of when it will actually be delivered, if they even stick to this!  Zero updates from them unless we email asking where it is. All in all, so far not a good experience at all.Update: 6th January. Our security system has still not been delivered and the package has apparently been lost. Final update!: After having to prove the package was lost even though we received an automated email from them saying it was. They did in fact send out a new one which was delivered. We also ordered a video doorbell but through Amazon where the delivery was much more reliable. I’ve seen some comments about the battery life of the doorbell but ours has been fantastic so far. All in all the system is good and we are pleased but the delivery ordeal I’m not sure was really worth it. I would suggest ordering through Amazon.

Review.Contenu: L70 without any SW Updates to improve performance. Accu not durable compaired to competitors, at least replacement worked quick.Overall It seems that Eufy's focus is directed on producing many different products in a very short timeframe, but support of existing products and product quality are lacking.

Unfortunately our home security system did not arrive after full payment. It has proved extremely difficult and frustrating to deal with you to resolve this issue. Is it an eufy or Evri (delivery company) issue? An answer from either side would be appreciated to finally resolve things

Eufy said they deliver with Amazon, but it will last 5 weeks with their replacement. With every mail and call it got less. And that’s what I call bad service. Why did they not ensure a short delivery time directly? In each mail and call I had to repeat, that I could have a new doorbell within two days, if I buy it at Amazon.

Review.Titre: I'm disappointed with my eufy robo vac…
Review.Contenu: I'm disappointed with my eufy robo vac G20.It took 5 days to arrive. It was difficult to connect to it via the app.It seems to clean the same area over and over again and ignore some easily accessible areas. It gets stuck under the sofa so I can't leave it unattended without moving a lot of furniture to block access. It doesn't always follow the pattern it is supposed to of going up and down the room, it spins round and seems confused. It loses power when left switched on on the charger. The brushes look as if they would need replacing frequently.  And the dog doesn't like it. I am sorry I bought it. It might be suutable for a house with small rooms, not much furniture and no pets.

Review.Titre: Doorbell camera failed after one year…
Review.Contenu: Doorbell camera failed after one year £91 for a new by one.   Help desk of little help     Disappointed

Purchased the EufyCam2Pro camera bundle and initially very pleased with the product. Then 1.5 years later one of the cameras becomes defective. Attempted all the suggested troubleshooting ideas, but the device wouldn’t switch on at all. Completely dead. Approached Eufy to seek replacement but told as outside 12 month warranty by 5-6 months, they couldn’t do anything for me. I had paid for the more expensive product to reduce recharge amounts. The camera had only been charged twice from new. Kept getting rebuffed by Eufy for a repair or replacement camera and escalated complaint explaining rights under Consumer Rights Act 2015, that products require to last a reasonable amount of time regardless of warranty. Eufy admitted the product was defective and hadn’t lasted a reasonable time, however still wouldn’t repair or replace the camera as out of warranty. After many emails Eufy finally offered a 30% off voucher for me to purchase a new add-on camera. Overall I’ve been very disappointed in Eufy’s customer service regarding their defective product, and they have blankly rejected consumer rights legislation. Products are only good as long as they don’t break or fail. The company on the other hand have left a very poor experience.
Unfortunately long delivery time and no free returns

Review.Titre: Eufy Video Doorbell won't recharge...No full refund
Review.Contenu: I purchased the Eufy Video doorbell over other known brands considering they provide local video storage.  Initial installation went through Ok without major issues. However the battery of the video doorbell went dried within 3 months.  When I put the doorbell on recharge, the battery won't charge at all.  I tried multiple troubleshooting guidelines but without any success.  I contacted the customer support a couple of times during this period.  They asked me to perform a few steps.  However later on I was told that they will need to replace the doorbell as nothing was working.  They offered me either a replacement or a 70% refund of the original cost.  I requested for a full refund which was declined as my purchase was just over 90 days before the equipment failed to work.  Obviously this was a manufacturing defect, and I had purchased this product only a couple months ago I asked for a full refund which the agent said they will try.  I returned the equipment in its original condition as per instructions by Eufy.  However after a couple of days of returning the product I was informed that they will be unable to provide me with full refund and only 70% amount will be returned.   This is particularly annoying after their initial commitment on 15/06 that I will be provided with a FULL REFUND once I returned the parcel.  I am very unhappy with this service as I would have expected Eufy to give me a full refund considering its a mfg defect.  I am left with a bit of disappointment due to this experience.

Review.Titre: Eufy Floodlight Camera 2K fails to perform as advertised!
Review.Contenu: Eufy say the Floodlight Camera 2K is “built to withstand freezing cold winters” but if the temperature falls below -20c (-4f) the camera will activate constantly and fill up your storage with useless recordings. So this product is not much use in most parts of Canada and some colder US states.Eufy say the Floodlight Camera 2K has “powerful built-in AI” but it can’t distinguish the difference between a real moving object and shadows caused by sunlight - this causes near-constant alerts, which also fills up your storage with useless recordings (even when set to the lowest sensitivity). So not much use if you have trees on your property and it’s a sunny day with a light wind.I reached out to Eufy to express my disappointment and this is what they suggested…Eufy say: Set the detection type to “Human Only” instead of “All Motion”Problem this creates is that we are no longer alerted to vehicles entering our property, or bears rummaging through our bins, or other wildlife that could pose a danger I.e. wolves/coyotes. Also, it doesn’t always identify a human as a human, which is troubling. It also does not fix the problem.Eufy say: change the defined “Activity Zone”This would largely defeat the intended purpose of buying the Floodlight Camera 2K.I tried submitting a review of my experience on the Eufy website (twice) but neither were published. There are currently 71 reviews for this product and curiously every review is rated 5 stars, my review was less than 5 stars and I suspect dark forces are preventing you from hearing about the experience of real life customers. I asked Eufy why it was that my review was not published and this is what their customer support manager said… “For the review, you could check if you have set the filter to 5 stars only, change it to all review will be ok, we would not have any operation on that” Clear as mud right?In summary then… for a premium $300 Floodlight Camera it fails to deliver on the most important features and the customer support provided to date has been underwhelming. I would recommend that you avoid this product until they refine the firmware or consider other options.

Honebasex2 and Homebase 3 purchase.  Be cautious and check functioning and suitability of need.Not happy with the erroneous support received.Have Homebase 2 camera system installed.  Works well, though the inability of Eufy to allow easy backups of data is unacceptable.  You have to slowly from the App download each and every picture.  Poor and delibetate.  Their promise to allow bulk backup NOT honoured.Like a fool I  have just  bought a Homebase 3 unit, fitted SSD to allow IN THEORY years of footage to be stored.  I question everything at the moment, so contacted customer care.Customer support today advised that irrespective of what I did ALL recordings are deleted after 30 days....and "sorry that our technology does not meet your needs".  What a farce.  Misinformation and misselling concerns officially raised.The agent could not explain HOW data is automatically deleted from an unconnected Homebase 2 when NOT connected to the Internet.  I was just going to store and leave Homebase 2 with it's data.  With Homebase 3, stated same.  ALL date after 30 days will be deleted off the SSD.    How?  Why?  I sent this email and voice recordings.  Will update as I progress.  I believe the agent did not know what he was talking about.   If he is correct, then Eufy will have major issues to contend with.Email content sent today:HelloTotally unacceptable response following my call to your customer helpline today.Your agent specifically told me that on Homebase 2 that ALL RECORDINGS will be deleted AFTER 30 fay's irrespective of the SSD space availability.    Additionally I explained that it WOULD NOT BE CONNECTED, just retained should I meed to access recorded data.  He advised that after 30 days ALL DATA would be deleted.This cannot be the case.On HOMEBASE 3 I was advised that even though I have a hard drive fitted, that AFTER 30 days, data would be deleted automatically.  This must be incorrect.I understand that on both systems, that once the SDD OR HD is full, then the EARLIEST recordings will ne deleted....but NOT ALL just because it is the 30th day I have tried to reason with your agent, but he says I am wrong and SORRY the technology does not meet my needs.Please investigate and provide written documentation of technical details to support.  I am concerned your marketing information misrepresents.  Your agent says one cannot SAVE years of data if required.I am reserving my right to return Homebase 3 on the basis of misselling, UNLESS your agent is as I expect providing erroneous advice.

He finally told me (about 5 months after I first raised a ticket) that there had been a bug introduced by EUFY that stopped the homebase talking to Alexa, and it may/not ever be fixed. As soon as he knew I had bought the unit over 12 months ago. He simply stated tough! So I paid well over £120 for a doorbell that worked for 9 months - and EUUFY don't give a monkeys!Thanks a lot

Subject: Complaint Regarding Delayed Support for FloodCam on Homebase3 and Homebase2Dear [Customer Service],I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to express my dissatisfaction and disappointment with the delayed support for the FloodCam feature on both the Homebase3 and Homebase2 devices I have purchased.In early February, I made the decision to purchase a Homebase3 based on the information provided that it would support the FloodCam feature by the end of March. However, to my dismay, the release date was continuously pushed back, leaving me waiting for this promised functionality. Now, I am eagerly hoping that the FloodCam support will indeed be available by the end of August, as initially announced.To provide some context, I encountered a similar situation with the Homebase2 in the past. I was informed by your support team that the FloodCam support was expected to be implemented by the end of 2022. Unfortunately, this support never materialized, leaving me without the features I had been eagerly anticipating.As a customer, it is disheartening to experience these repeated delays and unfulfilled promises. I invested in these products based on the assurances provided by your company, and it is frustrating to see these commitments not being met. This situation has caused inconvenience and has led me to question the reliability of your product development and release schedules.I kindly request that you provide me with an update on the status of the FloodCam support for both the Homebase3 and Homebase2 devices. Additionally, I would appreciate a transparent explanation as to why these features have been consistently delayed or not delivered as promised.Moreover, I would like to express my hope that this situation will be resolved promptly and that the announced support for the FloodCam on the Homebase3 by the end of August will be honored. It is crucial for customers like myself to have confidence in the products we purchase and the reliability of the information provided by your company.Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and a satisfactory resolution.Yours sincerely,T. Neumann

Great quality but 2 shortfalls. The base has to connect by ethernet to your router and then each camera has to connect to the base. If you have a 200 year old house and your router is at one end, it's almost impossible to mount a camera covering ghe other end. The signal can't get through the distance and the walls. Plus there is no booster available. So being able to connect 16 cameras is great but if you have a house big enough to need 16 cameras, ots too big for the signal to reach.Second, the camera quality is excellent, but the pir only triggers for close movement. So being able to see the boundary clearly is one thing, but an intruder can hop over and wander around without triggering a camera. More range on the pir please.

Ordered 1/7/23 Saturday via Eufy UK Web Page 5 items, 4 x C24s & 1 x S220 cameras the C24s arrived 4/7/23 Tuesday with Amazon the S220 on 6/7/23 with EVRi. C24's in a paper A4 envelope (not padded type, just as well not out in any rain) and their own boxes not surrounded by any protective packaging in their boxes or included in the papers envelope. I thought this strange as rattling around wouldn't be the safest for their longevity I thought. The S220 was at least in a padded envelope but again no protective packing included. The buying process was standard and payment along with updates on progress occurred. Overall pleased just wait and see if the cameras stand up after the shipping process.Update 11/8/23 The camera have been working perfectly  with picture quality of streaming, captured events and notifications really excellent. Was on holiday for a week and felt content leaving the house unattended as had been broken into some years back. I have recommend to others with a brother in law purchasing a number of C24s (hadn't seen the loyalty scheme but never mind) and he has similar praise as much better than an outdoor system he had professionally installed 5 years ago. Really happy and would use Eufy by Anker products again!

Review.Titre: Cool Vacuum Roboter but also a few negative Aspekts
Review.Contenu: I have purchased the Robovac X8 hybrid using a discount. Therefore the price/performance ratio was quite good. The Robovac X8 hybrid works well as vacuum cleaner with hard floor. The creation of the map via App was also easy and the room cleaning function or spot cleaning and scheduled cleanings are perfect. But we experienced also a lot of negative aspects. The navigation has sometimes a problem with our doorstep between kitchen and floor. We‘ve got the same doorstep to all our rooms, but somehow the combination of the doorstep and a corner leads to confusion for the Robovac. Then he gives out an error, that he is blocked. After pressing play a few times (and a few errors) he then manages to get out of the doorway and continues cleaning. Unfortunately the mob function is quite useless, since the mob drys out and only two spots (where the water comes out of the water tank) are further mobbed. This leaves stripes on the floor. Therefore we no longer use the mob.Further, after a week one wheel broke. The support has then send us a spare part, which I installed. Since the first wheel did last only one week, I am curious to see how long the replacement will last.

Review.Titre: Great products let down by the Customer Service
Review.Contenu: The Eufy security camera kit really is top notch. I switched to it from the Blink System as I wanted something that was TRULY subscription free AND function-rich. All of the products I have tick these boxes and feel quality; I have no complaints about how well they work.So, why only three stars then? The last few months have been plagued with a saga getting hold of the S100 light. When I ordered in March, delivery was scheduled for ‘end of March’, which was perfectly ok. This then slipped to the end of April. To early May. To end of May. To early June. Throughout this period I spoke to a variety of customer service agents who were either unable to help or simply seemed disinterested. A ‘Stock issue due to high demand’ was quoted as the reason for the delays. Given the ‘stock issue and high demand’, you can probably imagine my surprise when in early May I, waiting for my existing order, was presented with the S100 being sold on Eufy's Amazon store with next day delivery available. I again raised this with customer service and I was told ‘it’s a different warehouse’ - which coming from the main supplier felt like a poor excuse. No further assistance, or recompense for the ever-extending delay, offered.On the 1st of June my S100 finally arrived, six days after stock suddenly reappeared on the Eufy site with a £30 off price reduction, which having paid the original amount and been made to wait months, somewhat grated. Again, a lovely product. But come on Eufy… don’t add insult to injury to existing customers you have kept waiting for months! It lets your products down and earns you poor reviews.

Review.Titre: Overall pretty good but could be better
Review.Contenu: Overall pretty good (after the X8 Hybrid I bought an X8 Pro SES), but some things are annoying.Firstly, the mapping. You cannot add a room (or, for that matter, delete one), you have to re-do the entire floor for this. Then, when mapping, the software registers areas which are not part of the room, e.g. space the other side of a glass patio door. Of course the robot is not going there but the map looks silly. It should be pobbible to delete areas from the map. The self-emptying has been capricious. It thinks there is a blockage and refuses to self-empty. I assume it was becasue after the first cleaning there was indeed a lot of pet hair. Hopefully with self-emptying set after each clean, this will not be a problem, but the testing should have highlighted this and probablu the robot should be sent back to self-empty in the same way as it goes back to re-charge mid-job if necessary. The ability to climb over thresholds could be a lot better. On the X8 Hybrid at least it's poor, it cannot negotiate a 3/4 inch (20mm) threshold in the doorway. On the positive side, multi-mapping is good, connection with the app robust, handles stairs well (anti-drop), and the virtual boundary and no-mop area are useful. The X8 Pro does not have "no-mop", so one hopes it's clever enough to not mop carpets...
Quick delivery which is good once your order has been placed it's out the door following day.
IT does what ist expected.Some error messages are poping up without any meaning.Installation brackets are Not fulfilling all needs.

Comprising:- EufyCam 3 cameras- Homebase 3- E340 Video doorbellThis is a fantastic product that is so easy to set up and configure. The solar panels keep the camera charged, even on my north-facing wall in the UK in December. The wifi connection is solid and makes the cameras easy to install. I would give it 5 stars, but for a few omissions:1) E340 Wireless doorbell - you can't configure a smartphone to open up automatically when the door bell is rung (I'm told this might be solved in the future)2) You cannot connect non-Eufy cameras to the system, so I cannot connect my nestbox cameras.3) E340 wireless doorbell - the angle of the lower camera (for watching the doorstep) is fixed, so it can miss part of the doorstep.But, all-in-all it looks like the best on the market.

Review.Titre: Great products, easy to set up and use, just one issue regarding anti-theft of external cameras...

A good/fair price point and very easy to set up also with a intuitive app, several configuration settings and AI recognition. My only critique at this time (using their cameras for a just a couple of weeks) is that outdoor cameras could easily be stolen, from what I can see, no anti-theft device I can see on Eufy site. That said, I guess any external device can be fairly easily ripped off the wall? A related challenge is if stolen cameras could be sold and re-used and I my understanding is that they could be. This is my reason for 4* instead of 5*.

Review.Titre: Good picture with solar powered camera
Review.Contenu: Overall I’m very happy with the Eufy S330 Eufycam setup I purchased recently. The app is generally easy to use for setting up the system, the recordings are reasonable by night and very good by day.They recommend extending the inbuilt memory but it’s a devil of a job finding the link in the software that formats the hard drive you have inserted. A proper manual would be useful. It gets a laborious deleting yesterdays videos, I haven’t found a way of deleting a days supply in one go. Customer service gets you in contact with a chatbot that was no help for my problem but I got a human email the next day. The camera seems a bit slow in picking up people approaching the house, possibly due to a restricted range of movement detection. The postman is halfway to the front door before it picks him up. The AI for people recognition is very hit and miss, recognising me and my wife about half the time. It works better with our pet dog. My iPhone has just bleeped that someone is outside but on checking the camera it’s a pigeon!

Review.Titre: Great robot except for the little…
Review.Contenu: Great robot except for the little things!I had a problem with the eufy X9 pro on Monday (09/04/2023). So I wrote an email to eufy. The help/email came promptly/today on Tuesday. The service is good. The device is of high quality.However, the following points that make the device perfect are missing!- In the station a dust discharge- low design (1 cm about too high)- a container in the cleaning station with cleaning agent

Review.Titre: Products and Service are ok to good
Review.Contenu: Products and Service are ok to good, but the range is too low and there is no easy way to range extend from home base 3 to cameras. And there is no Apple HomeKit support yet nor can the new SoloCam be integrated in Home Base 3 yet. These topics are essential.

Review.Titre: The camera is a well engineered piece…
Review.Contenu: The camera is a well engineered piece of equipment. The instructions relatively easy to follow and the installation was straight forwards. Then operation of the camera is also very easy to perform via the Eufy App. This all good news except for: There was, unfortunately, a part missing from the pack, this is the white coloured central screw cap, and I e mailed and also telephoned Eufy’s Customer Services. This was not a good experience and after the exchange of several e mails I have come to the conclusion that it is unlikely the missing part will be replaced. The customer service staff was polite but was not able to action my very simple request - please may I have a central screw cap?

Over all a good video doorbell at a reasonable price, and no recurring fee. Two things to note, on this the wired option there is no installation instructions regarding the wiring,  not in the manual or the app setup guidance. That said you can get pretty good info online.The other issue I have, it doesn’t always detect a person at the door, seems 50-50, but does always when the doorbell is rang, so still does the job.

Really good camera. Quality amazing, app and instructions brill.Only tiny drawbacks so far imo is even with face recognition setup it still records myself and sends notification which is pointless. Also the record function is only motion activated and unable to be left on permanent and set to overwrite Daily

Decided to install a home security system, and wanted to avoid ongoing storage charges. After purchasing a 4 camera set, and installing them in reasonably tamperproof positions, we realised that the camera doorbell would be needed to give the best all-round coverage. I then used the online chat to find out which battery version would save to the homebase3.After a short wait had the required feedback and ordered online too. System fully up and running now, although some of the APP + AI features still need to be understood. Only question at present is how long the battery charge will hold, as not all cameras get full sunlight.It would help if there was an initial set up guidance to ensure that the wifi signal is strong enough in all chosen locations?

Easy setup, great handling!Only two minor negative points:1. The person-alert is somewhat inconsistent. Sometimes, I receive an alert when my rabbits move through the picture, sometimes I don't. But up to now it hasn't missed a person, yet.2. I can't access the camera via my smartphone when I'm not connected to WLAN. Doesn't matter whose WLAN it is but as soon as I try to access the camera somewhere on my way, e.g. in the grocery store, I can't connect with the camera. It's a bit annoying but for me it's fine since the longest time of the day I am connected to some WLAN.

Review.Titre: Very pleased with the vacuum cleaner…
Review.Contenu: Very pleased with the vacuum cleaner but could not get the app to recognize it. Using the remote control is easy though, just press A for automatic mode and off it goes. You can also select suction power level on the remote. I have two cats and let my robo vacuum do an auto clean once a day until battery runs out and it returns to charge. The cleaner collects a lot of dust, small pieces of grit and cat hair, my floors have never looked so clean. Would have rated it 5* had it worked with the app.

Easy ordering process and quick delivery. 4 stars because the cashback offer via TopCashback failed to work and has generated the need to raise a query, which can take months to resolve. Disappointing lack of cake icing.

Good Eufy Support. My G30 Robotic Vacuum had a failing brush motor. I was pretty sure it wasn't under warranty, so asked for links on how to order parts, and how to do it. I was sent links to instructions and where to buy the part, and once it arrived I fitted it and all is ok again.

Review.Titre: Device is good - 4k quality in doubt.
Review.Contenu: Device is good - 4k quality in doubt. Some unexpleianed behaviour - like the hard disk suddenly reformatting itself. And customer service having no idea about the product they support.
My home is more secure. Although this is not a burglar alarm system, it certainly helps as a deterrent. Instructions are clear and it works well. The option of cloud storage is excellent.

Easy to setup, App is easy to use,Pictures very clear.One thing I can’t seem to do is get the scheduling into geofencing mode to run the schedule when at home.Would definitely recommend these cameras. I’ve also used the black covers to help hide them in some places, again easy n quick to put on.

The doorbell video unit works a treat … crisp pictures, great notifications, excellent piece of kit. SO useful.However .. the setting up was a nightmare. I was using an Android phone and all was going well until I was asked to ‘give home a name’ , or something similar. The app refused to accept anything. I went online and discovered others had had a similar experience, which was quite depressing.Fortunately I have an iPad, downloaded the Apple version of the app and was able to complete the setup. Had I not had an iPad, or indeed not thought of using it, the app would have been useless.It now works fine on the iPad AND Android phone, but that software needs looking at.(Also remember to set ‘roaming data’ if you intend to view away from your home).
The product didnt meet my expectation. The product and construction is not made for househelds with a dog. The communication with eufy was excellent. Return of the Cleaner was without discussions.

Good fast delivery and competitive pricing. Easy to set up..did two bells in less than an hour including app setup and installation. Slight problem with balancing getting enough notifications and getting too many but that’s solvable

Review.Contenu: This time I appreciate to use a discount voucher. The last sending was done more convenient for me via Austrian "Post" which is putting it into special box in my house with tag in mailbox to open later when I am in office at delivery time. At this sending I had to meet the UPS delivery man.

Received the entry level eufy 1080P with the 2C camera. Setting up the app and mounting the cameras was easy. Provides very good image quality. However, it would be good to have an additional face detection.

Review.Contenu: Very easy to set up and clear pictures. Ours is set to human only but seems to alert the bbq as a human quite regularly and also keeps alerting when the washing blows. Overall pleased and would recommend.

The product itself is perfect, but the order process was not really transparent. After i asked the support I got the information that my order was a preorder and the product not available
Great product, works well. Easy to setup, install and reliable at motion/people detection. Good value for money. Sometimes software is temperamental in connecting/updating from camera footage.

Review.Titre: Only had the door for a short time but…

Review.Contenu: Really wasy to set up and install, camera image very clear both during day and night. I like that when using app you can zoom in from recordings to see a more detailed image.

Review.Titre: Eufy 1080 video doorcam used it for 2…
Review.Contenu: Eufy 1080 video doorcam used it for 2 weeks now apart from the battery life which in no way would you get 180 days, video pics is very clear, but set it to human only otherwise you’ll be picking all kinds up from moving cars to cats, but it does the job. The app is very good also, changing settings is easy and the setting up was no problem whatsoever it was on my door in 20 mins after fully charging it up. Had the battery life been better l would have given it 5 *’s, but the best you’ll do with it without charging the battery which is easy enough is about 2-3 weeks if your lucky.Still it does the job l wanted it for and charging it is not particularly hard, l don’t know wether this model as the Ai included with it l’m presuming it doesn’t because it pings everytime l go near the door. It also has a setting in which you can turn it off which is handy for when  the kids are running around in the street, and it’s constantly going off but it’s a nosy bleeder and picks almost everything up.All in all a good purchase

Pro: connection base/cameras/mobile phone very easy and fast, great picture quality also at night time, design of the camerasCon: the cameras do not start the recording immediately when a person is detected, they start three to four seconds later, so the person is just out of sight sometimes

Item was delayed with stock issues but when I complained as I wanted before I went on holiday and it said 3-5 business days when I ordered they did knock a bit off the price and refunded that tbf And received item after about 3 weeks

Good product so far, very clear images and recordings.Slight delay before showing on phone,but not a major issue.Bought the video doorbell from  Eufy after Christmas in their sale. Great price, very pleased.

Review.Titre: The product is perfect - shipping time a bit long
Review.Contenu: The product is perfect, video quality really great, had quite problems to handle the small screws, after 1 hour trying, we could figure it out, shipping time was a bit long, customer support is great!

Tech support service has been very responsive and helpful (although a few product shortcomings are yet to be resolved) - Overall, it seems to be a good purchase so far.

Being as honest as possible believe me I am no IT expert. I found initially the size of the bell larger than expected but that's ok.  Setting it up was way more difficult than I imagined. Connecting to the router and the bell and the phone did almost get me throwing it across the room but once I got there it was fine. The sensor is quite fine and setting the area of coverage has to be quite good so as not to activate on people simply walking past and cars passing on the street. I set it up on 1 phone and when i tried to share it with the second phone it deleted off the first phone so I will have to try again. I definitely think I will have to buy an extension chime as the ringer is very quiet. The recording quality is great and the fact there is no monthly fee is the reason I chose this bell. Once I am used to it I'm sure I will get better. Would I recommend it ? Yes and already have to family and friends

Review.Titre: Advanced, reliable and cost effective ip cams and surveillance app
Review.Contenu: I have installed 10 eufy ip cameras across 3 residences (a mix of indoor / outdoor & battery cams, including one homebase 2). All components and apps work really well, except for 1) Flood Cam 2 Pro - intermittently delivers sound only (I.e. “black” video) or goes totally offline and needs to be hard booted to recover (rarely remote soft restart will work)2) the Cam 2 pro battery charge does not last a full year (more like 8 months, but that’s still very good!)3) streaming to web browser is spotty and unreliable (not important for us as the App works well on iPhone and iPad)Considering the complexity of our set-up and requirements the (multiple residences across two continents), the eufy products and solution are actually quite advanced, reliable and cost effective. It’s also helpful that the cloud storage (not a “must” to order, as local storage only is optionally available) covers up to 10 cameras, which we fully utilize.Set-up and installation is guided via the app - very straight forward and takes just minutes… impressive!Technical  support is also very responsive and worked through the issue 1) above with the result they will swap the Flood Cam … once I can finally get to it at its remote location to dismount and return.Overall I can definitely  recommend eufy ip cams and the surveillance app (except the Flood Cam 2 pro). Nifty package and range of solutions.

It arrived three weeks later than expected but is is well packaged and good instructions. I made my own additional back plate to make it stand out from the wall it is fixed to. Works well and looks good.

I found Eufy security camera sets with homebase very suitable for that task. So i ordered it, charged the batteries, paired the cameras to homebase and all went smooth incl. a firmware update. I mounted the cameras at a suitable heigth and was happy jiust in time. This solution runs for nearly 2 weeks and I can recommend it due to its quick installation and high quality of video recordings. The intercom feature is also perfect to response to the postman etc. when ringing the doorbell.

I bought a battery camera and chime doorbell. After 4 months I had a problem with the video going black and after contacting eufyy through their chat system  and trying all their suggestions I then couldn't get the camera to reconnect. It was frustrating so I clicked on the e warranty on the app and requested a replacement.  I had a quick reply and was asked to post the camera and chime back to them and they would then send me a new one and refund my postage.  I was a bit apprehensive about this but I emailed photo of package and the return receipt from the post office. I postage it all back on a Saturday and by the following Friday I had a new replacement camera and chime and my postage had been refunded. I dealt with April from Anker throughout the returns process and her customer service was excellent.  The new one is working fine.
I received a new battery wich which works well.
Everything as expected!Like always, a great brand!!!
